ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: The main strength of the course was the knowledge of the professor on a wide array of issues. The chief weakness was the amount of reading material for each session, I don't think I was able to go in depth on any of the topics covered in class. Reading that is more targeted would be good. Class discussion is also another strength of the course.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Alice M Miller  Ali's breadth of knowledge is unmatched, she forces you to critically think and engage with the material while challenging one's previously held assumptions.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: LOTS OF READING. PROVIDED AN OPPORTUNITY TO LEARN ABOUT A NUMBER OF DIVERSE TOPICS RELATED TO HUMAN RIGHTS, SEX, SEXUALITY, AND GENDER.
If one would like to gain a grasp over a variety of issues relating to sexuality, health and human rights, this would be a good course.
